explanation:
The report is not correct for the code as provided. The potentially-constant expression is inside an #ifdef MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR block: the runtime test if (digest_ext_error(&da)) is only compiled when MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR is defined. The additional code shows digest_ext_error(da) is defined to (false) as a fallback; that fallback definition is intended for the configuration where MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR is NOT defined. In other words, in any given translation unit after preprocessing either (a) MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR is defined and the if(...) appears and digest_ext_error will be provided as a runtime check (not the constant (false) fallback), or (b) MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR is not defined, the fallback macro digest_ext_error(…) = (false) may exist but the enclosing if is not compiled in. Therefore there is no configuration in which the source after preprocessing contains the if statement with an invariant constant controlling expression, so MISRA C:2023 Rule 14.3 is not violated here.

(If, however, a build were produced in which both MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR is defined and digest_ext_error is nevertheless defined as the constant (false), then that particular translation unit would contain an invariant controlling expression and would breach Rule 14.3. But given the code layout and intent shown, that situation should not arise.)
